title: Managed Service Provider (MSP) Mode
content:
Service Management provides the ability for shared services providers to manage their business units' and/or clients' request and incident records in a single interface using the multi-tenant (MT) console.

Each customer/business unit can use their own tenant but allow the “parent” to have direct access to the tickets from a consolidated view.

The MT console requires the Tenants to be set up in a specific way, and then Agents to be given appropriate permission to the MT console and “child” tenants.

If an agent has been granted the permissions on a specific managed tenant, when the agent clicks on an Individual record in the MT console, the record opens in a separate tab, and the agent is then inside that specific tenant. 

Suite Administration Configuration for MT Console

  1. Create an Account in the Suite Administration and set it with a Shared Service type of Provider.
  2. Add users to the provider account.
    • Two additional roles are now available for users.
      • Shared service admin: Assigned with MT Administrator role in Service Management automatically.
      • Shared service agents: Assigned with MT Agent role in Service Management automatically.
  3. Create a tenant as normal but set the “Shared service type” field to Provider.

    You need to assign licenses and deploy the tenant as normal. The Account field will also show an Icon to identify it as a Provider tenant.

  4. Create an Account in Suite Administration as normal but set the shared service type to Managed.
  5. Create users as normal within this Account.
  6. You now need to create the managed tenant. Create a tenant as normal except that you need to set the shared service type to Managed.
  7. Set the Account field to your “managed Account.”  You will see it has an icon associated with it.
  8. Assign Licenses and deploy the tenant as normal.
  9. After the Tenant has been deployed, go back to your Provider tenant and click on the Shared service tab.
  10. Click the “Add” button next to Managed tenant. Select the desired tenant you wish to add from the drop-down list. Only managed tenants are available.
  11. After adding the tenant, we now should add the users that we want to access this shared tenant's data. Click the Add button next to User access.
  12. In the pop-up box, select the user from the list and mark which modules they will have access to. Then repeat this for all users that you want to be able to access the tenant.
  13. Complete this for all users.

Currently, only incidents and requests can be managed. The users granted with Incident permission are assigned with Incident Manager role in the managed tenant automatically. The users granted with Request permission are assigned with Service Request Manager role in the managed tenant automatically. 

You can change the permissions of a user in Suite Administration by clicking the drop-down icon to the right of their name:  .

The proper permissions must be configured on the provider tenant and the managed tenants for users to be able to view or edit managed tenant records.

Service Management tenant Roles in Service Management Applied to
Provider tenant MT Administrator Admin only. Users with this role can add MT agents to the managed tenants. 
MT Agent All users who access managed tenant records.
Managed tenant Service Request Manager (recommended) All users who access request data for this managed tenant.

If role not assigned, then applicable view and/or edit permissions on requests and all related record types (such as person, group, service) must be assigned to these users.
Incident Manager(recommended) All users who access incident data for this managed tenant.

If role not assigned, then applicable view and/or edit permissions on incidents and all related record types (such as person, group, service) must be assigned to these users.

If you wish to modify the permissions on a given managed tenant, you will need to configure this within the tenant Roles permissions.

At this point, the configuration of the MT console is complete and you can log in to the Provider Tenant to use it. 

Using the MT Console

After creating the provider and Managed tenants, you can log in to the appropriate Service Management tenants to work on the tickets. This section shows what you would expect to see when logging into the different tenants.

Managed Tenant

As a user logging into a managed Tenant, you will see no difference in how the Service Management tenant operates. Any user from the Provider that has been given access via Suite Administration will be visible in the Person table, allowing them to be utilized as any other user (given permissions and roles or assigned to groups, etc.).

Screenshot of the menu of a managed tenant (name in the top left added via self-service portal settings) 

Provider Tenant

In the provider tenant, you see a few additions. Firstly for each managed tenant, you will find a company record in the vendor table.

If you then go to the full view of this record, there is an additional tab set up called “Managed Customer,” which provides view-only details of the information added in Suite Administration.

The Mega Menu for Service Management also has an additional option in the right-hand side section labeled “MT Console."

Clicking this will take you to a view of the managed tenants and the relevant tickets available for you to work on.

MT Console Tabs

The MT Console includes the following tabs.

Dashboard

Displays all managed customers including:

  • Total open requests and incidents for all managed tenants on the top right of the dashboard.
  • An icon per managed customer displaying open incidents or requests for that managed client. Hovering on the icon displays a tooltip detailing the priority level of the open requests or incidents.
  • Totals for only the selected managed customers at the bottom of the dashboard. Each is a link to view the requests or incidents of the selected customers in the request or incident grid. 

The information in the MT Console Dashboard is filtered to display only active incidents and requests by default.

You can add additional filters to limit the information you can view in the dashboard which works in the same way as it does on any other view filter in Service Management; however, the number of fields available is limited.

You can also use the dashboard to select the customers to view in the requests and incidents grids.

  • Select a client by clicking the icon.
  • A selected customer has a checkmark added to its icon.
  • You can select up to five customers to view in the grids.

Requests

A grid view of the open requests for selected customers. You can select up to five customers to view in the grid.

Incidents

A grid view of the open incidents for selected customers. You can select up to five customers to view in the grid.
